Instruction:
Task Description: Implement a WebSocket server class for handling real-time communication between clients, including connection management, message broadcasting, and error handling.

Class Description: ChatServer is a WebSocket server implementation that extends WebSocketServer from org.java_websocket library. It manages client connections, processes incoming messages (both text and binary), broadcasts messages to all connected clients, and handles connection events and errors.

Attributes:
- (Inherited from WebSocketServer) port: int - The port number on which the server listens
- (Inherited from WebSocketServer) address: InetSocketAddress - The network address of the server
- (Inherited from WebSocketServer) draft: Draft_6455 - The WebSocket protocol draft being used

Methods:
- ChatServer(int port) -> None - Constructor that initializes the server with specified port
- ChatServer(InetSocketAddress address) -> None - Constructor that initializes the server with specified socket address
- ChatServer(int port, Draft_6455 draft) -> None - Constructor that initializes the server with specified port and protocol draft
- onOpen(WebSocket conn, ClientHandshake handshake) -> void - Handles new client connections, sends welcome message, and notifies other clients
- onClose(WebSocket conn, int code, String reason, boolean remote) -> void - Handles client disconnections and notifies other clients
- onMessage(WebSocket conn, String message) -> void - Processes incoming text messages and broadcasts to all clients
- onMessage(WebSocket conn, ByteBuffer message) -> void - Processes incoming binary messages and broadcasts to all clients
- onError(WebSocket conn, Exception ex) -> void - Handles errors that occur during WebSocket operations
- onStart() -> void - Initializes server settings when the server starts
